metadata.title: CVE-2022-31742 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
An attacker could have exploited a timing attack by sending a large numberof allowCredential entries and detecting the difference between invalid keyhandles and cross-origin key handles. This could have led to cross-originaccount linking in violation of WebAuthn goals. This vulnerability affectsThunderbird < 91.10, Firefox < 101, and Firefox ESR < 91.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31742` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
